title: Data Scientist
description:
As a Data Scientist at QuantCo, you will learn what it takes to create impact from data: identifying the right framework to translate a business question into a statistical problem; locating and combining data sources as well as transforming large datasets; running in-depth analyses; building machine learning models that automate large-scale decisions and integrating them into live business processes; and interpreting, visualizing, and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.




Aspiring data scientists should be team players with excellent quantitative abilities and:




A degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, industrial engineering or similar fields from a leading university
Experience in coding and working with data using a wide range of tools and languages: Python (Pandas, XGBoost/LightGBM), R (dplyr, ggplot2), and git
Bonus: SQL, Tensorflow/Keras, Cloud infrastructure, Docker, and a lower-level language like C/C++/C#
In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques
Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see
High level of commitment and reliability, good balance of pragmatism and perfectionism
Business proficiency in English and ideally conversational proficiency in German




Compensation

We are looking for exceptionally motivated and highly skilled candidates for available data scientist positions. We offer a generous compensation package that includes a base salary, bonus, and stock options along with additional benefits based on location.




About QuantCo

We leverage expertise in data science, engineering, and economics to help organizations turn data into decisions. Started by 4 PhDs from Harvard and Stanford, we are now more than 90 professionals with extensive quantitative, engineering, and business experience.




QuantCo’s product line includes algorithmic pricing, data-driven claims management, and high-dimensional forecasting solutions. Our clients are some of the largest financial, retail, and healthcare organizations in the U.S. and Europe. 




We are excited about writing code that affects millions of people and impacts billions of dollars. If you feel the same way, we look forward to hearing from you.




QuantCo does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Software Engineer - Computer Vision & Machine Learning Algorithm Optimization
description:
We are looking for an engineer to work on our computer vision and machine learning stack by extracting valuable information from our drone’s sensors and use it to improve our remote autonomous security system.

This position is open to internships.

Tasks

Design and develop computer vision and/or machine learning algorithms
Come up with novel product focused ideas
Deploy and test your algorithms in the real world on an autonomous drone system
Write clean code in Python and/or C++Collaborate with an interdisciplinary team of engineers

Requirements

Programming skills in Python and/or C++
Experience implementing algorithms in Computer Vision, Machine Learning and/or Robotics
General understanding of geometric computer vision
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Robotics or similar
A passionate and creative mindset

If you feel like you can make our products more intelligent, get in touch.
Industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Computer & Network Security

title: Work Student Data Scientist
description:
Can your talent for data science help build our next generation Risk Management solutions? Curious working in a stimulating and challenging environment of a multinational company? We are looking for a talent with a positive can-do attitude who is able to think "out of the box”. Apply for this exciting position in Zurich’s Group Risk Analytics team and support our Risk Data Analytics Strategy!

Now is the time to move forward and make a difference. At Group Risk Management, we want you to share your unique perspectives, experiences, and ideas so we can grow and drive sustainable change together.

You will be introduced to a broad spectrum of topics while working on several priorities in close collaboration with many team members.

The role provides a great opportunity to collaborate closely with many experts, while being empowered to bring in and present own ideas.

What You Will Do


Support the team’s work with stakeholders, colleagues across the wider data function, and cross-functional peers to translate business objectives into clearly defined advanced analytics models and produce business insights to achieve our data and business accountabilities
Build data pipelines to ingest, wrangle and blend a wide variety of disparate data from internal and external sources
Perform exploratory data analysis on incoming data assets to inform potential solutions and assess data quality
Contribute to and support the development, maintenance and deployment of machine/deep learning solutions
Help foster a positive and supportive team culture
Work location is Zurich, Switzerland


What You Bring


BSc degree or MSc student in quantitative discipline (computer science, data science, applied statistics, mathematics or a relevant quantitative field) or equivalent practical experience
Fluency in python programming, including data analytics (pandas, numpy) and machine/deep learning packages (scikit-learn, tensorflow, keras), as well as experience with SQL
Development of solutions using supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to production
Experience with Front-End development, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus
Good presentation and communication skills, with an ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
Fluency in English, German an advantageGiven the current situation, we might offer this job opportunity virtually. Key stakeholders are based in Zurich, Switzerland
Given the current travel restrictions you must be located in Switzerland or able to travel and base yourself in Switzerland for the duration of the working student contract.


Additional Information

The candidate will go through a technical programming test as this is the core skills we need. We look forward to receiving your online application.

Zurich wants to attract the best talent and we acknowledge that talents might not always be available full-time. At Zurich we will consider requests for flexible working. Many of our employees work flexibly in a variety of ways. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility you may need.

At Zurich, we foster a culture of diversity and inclusion. Our 53,000 employees worldwide live our values to protect you, to inspire confidence and help you reach your full potential. We promote opportunities for equity among our professionals, regardless of gender, differently abled, LGBTQ +, race, ethnicity, generations, belief, etc.

title: Internship 2021, Software Data Engineer
description:
Job Reference #

236513BR

City

Zürich, Switzerland - Zürich

Your role

Are you solid as a rock when you’re juggling a lot of projects? Do you know how to talk to all kinds of different people?

What we are looking for

Technical and business acumen. You understand requirements beyond the written word. Whether you’re working on a research report or an API used by other developers, an internal tool consumed by our operation teams, or a feature used by millions of customers, your attention to details leads to a delightful user experience.
Fast learner. We’re looking for software engineers who thrive on learning new technologies and don’t believe in one-size-fits-all solutions. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the needs of our massive growth and rapidly evolving business environment. You have advanced knowledge of at least one programming language (e.g., Python or JavaScript) and knowledge of or eagerness to learn others for example PostgreSQL, React.
Fearlessness. You think a working proof-of-concept is the best way to make a point. You strive on proving that speed and quality are not conflicting; that you can achieve both at the same time.
Passion. You feel ownership over everything you ship; you'd never call code "released" until you’re confident it’s correct. You pride yourself on efficient monitoring, strong documentation, and proper test coverage.
A team player. You believe that you can achieve more on a team — that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others' candid feedback for continuous improvement.


Your team

You’ll be working in the Chief Investment Office, Digital Transformation "POT" team in Zurich. The POT team is the only centralized and the only globally focused operations team at CIO. "POT" is an acronym that stands for Process, Optimization, and Technology and in reality, the role of the POT is much broader. The team exists to tackle and help tackle the largest, most impactful Ops challenges at CIO, regardless of whether that means supporting another team at CIO to take the lead or it means solving it ourselves.

Your expertise

You need have completed your bachelor’s or master’s degree / at least four semesters of your bachelor’s degree or have obtained your masters' degree within the last 6 months.

In particular, you have

completed your technical bachelor’s degree or have great technical work experience
strong analytical, problem-solving and synthesizing skills
solid experience in developing applications using multiple different coding languages (Python, JavaScript, …)
UX development experience
experience in developing MicroServices/APIs (SOAP & REST)
experience with relational databases
experience with the agile development methodologies and test driven development
good report-writing and documentation skills, good verbal communication skills
strong troubleshooting ability with extensive hands-on IT support experience, both back-end and user-facing. Able to generate options and recommend solutions which are logical reasonable and realistic.
ability to analyze existing legacy processes and provide replacement solutions
ability to challenge the status quo and to generate new ideas and creative approaches.
able to develop and manage clear and realistic action plans to accomplish given objectives.

Start date October 2021

About Us

Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us

We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.

Disclaimer / Policy Statements

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

title: R&D Engineer (Data Science, Computer Vision, Machine/Deep Learning) (m/w/d)
description:
Aufgaben

Erarbeiten von integrierten Systemlösungen für die Detektion und Klassifikation von Flugobjekten auf Basis von elektro-optischen Sensoren (Image Processing)
Anwenden von bekannten Werkzeugen und Sprachen aus dem Bereich Data Science, Computer Vision und Machine/Deep Learning (Matlab, C++)
Betreuung von verschiedenen Hardware-Plattformen (CPU, GPU, Embedded) für Training und Einsatz von anwendungsspezifischen Entscheidungssystemen
Handhabung von grossen Datenmengen (Erfassung, Ablage, Annotation etc.)
Fachliches Führen von komplexen, nur grob definierten Entwicklungsaufgaben, bei denen der Lösungsweg sowohl selbstständig, aber auch in Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Fachabteilungen ermittelt werden muss
Erstellen von Systems- und Schnittstellenspezifikationen, eigenständige Erarbeitung und Umsetzung von Softwarelösungen
Durchführen umfassender Simulationen, Studien und Untersuchungen




Qualifikationen

Hochschulabschluss (ETH) als Ingenieur auf dem Gebiet der Informations- und Elektrotechnik mit Vertiefung in Data Science, Computer Vision und Machine/Deep Learning, gerne auch mit Promotion und/oder erster Berufserfahrung
Erfolgreich durchgeführte Projekte aus den Bereichen Segmentierung, Objektdetektion und Objektklassifikation mit Hilfe von Einzelbildern und Bildsequenzen
Vertraut mit anwendungsrelevanten Werkzeugen wie Matlab (Image Processing, Statistical & Machine Learning, Deep Learning Toolbox), C/C++ (OpenCV) und Werkzeugen zur Versionskontrolle (Mercurial, Git)
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Hohe Selbstständigkeit und gleichzeitig Fähigkeit zur Zusammenarbeit in interdisziplinären und interkulturellen Teams

title: Internship Program in Computer Vision
description:
Job Description

As a Computer Vision Software Engineer, you'll be responsible for delivering high-performance production software with state-of-the-art computer vision capabilities. Your code will be part of the foundations of our 3D platform that enables the next generation of computing applications for many years to come.

Responsibilities

Develop state-of-the-art performance critical perception systems
Own and drive highly visible performance metrics (e.g. latency, memory, bandwidth, power)
Collaboratively work as part of a fast paced team, analyze and optimize a growing C++ codebase
Help define performance standards for algorithms, develop and drive best practices (performance, maintainability, correctness, etc), provide guidance at all stages of the software development cycle and share knowledge
Help drive the integration and development of necessary tooling and automation (profiling, testing/verification, monitoring, etc) that allows the team to move even faster
Help drive computing platforms for next generation products

Qualifications

3+ years of professional experience with high performance / low latency applications with modern C++ and assembly languages
General understanding in Geometric Computer Vision
Experience with low latency / high bandwidth real-time algorithm pipelines and their runtime optimization (e.g. SIMD)
Strong CS fundamentals, problem-solving, high quality coding, code optimization, memory optimization, performance analysis, understanding of abstraction and modularity, critical path optimization and tuning

Preferred / Additional Skills

Geometric Computer Vision Experience (e.g. SLAM, VIO, 3D Reconstruction, etc.)
Image processing
Numerical computing

Education

BA/BS in CS, EE or similar required. MS or Ph.D. preferred.
Industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

title: Data Analyst
description:
Who we are

In a life without sound, our work provides meaning. As a leading provider of innovative hearing care solutions, we are not just a company that makes products: we are a team on a mission to help people enjoy the delight of hearing. To enable a life without limitations, we – through our core business brands Phonak, Unitron, Hansaton, Advanced Bionics and AudioNova – develop, manufacture and distribute solutions that push the limits of technology and redefine the future of our industry.


You will be an integral part of the Sonova Analytics Centre of Excellence, working alongside our talented team of data analysts, data scientists, and ML engineers, to design and implement cutting edge analytics solutions that help optimise processes, improve our products, and help the company reimagine the way data can be used to enhance people’s quality of life.

Your tasks

Prepare and analyse data from different data sources to identify patterns that help inform business decisions and proactively report on key metrics
Act as the primary contact with the business (focus on marketing/commercial) to identify and capture business requirements in partnership with domain experts
Communicate data insights effectively to business stakeholders
Define objectives also for data science projects, in partnership with Data Scientists
Partner with Visualisation Developers and Data Scientists to create reports and interactive dashboards
Help create training resources and facilitate training on analytical tools for internal users
Create documentation to communicate solution implementation and help standardise and optimise data analytics processes
Partner with the Business Warehouse development team to create new data models and views that enable more efficient analysis and reporting
Collaborate with other members in the team to define and measure the success of new solutions


Your profile

University degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, Math or Physics is preferred
2-5 years of experience in an analytical role and/or ability to demonstrate strong analytical skills, preferred in the healthcare/medical device industry
Proven record and experience in marketing/commercial analytics
Digital marketing analytics experience incl. pricing marketing promotion ROI, omnichannel attribution, etc.
Passionate about data and its value in improving people’s lives
Able to communicate technical aspects succinctly to both technical & non-technical stakeholders
Ability to effectively adapt to change and willingness to learn and apply new technologies, processes, and tools
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python or R Skills, Power BI or Tableau, Microsoft Office; experience using JIRA and familiarity with SharePoint, Confluence, Dash Plotly, RShiny or similar is a plus
Excellent English skills, written and spoken, any other additional languages are a plus


Our offer

We can offer you a new challenge, with interesting tasks and much more - including an open corporate culture, flat hierarchies, support for further training and development, opportunities to take on responsibility, an excellent range of foods, sports and cultural facilities, attractive employment conditions, and flexible working time models in various roles.

Kira Maurer, Talent Acquisition Manager, is looking forward to receiving your complete application (cover letter, cv, references and certificates) via our online job application platform.

For this vacancy only direct applications will be considered.

title: DATA ENGINEER - Dubai or Remote
description:
About Us

Experience with interacting with databases and building microservices
Knowledge of cloud infrastructure technology (AWS, Azure, etc)

The chance to be part of a movement shaping the future of our world’s financial system
An amazing team of highly skilled and motivated people
The possibility to do part of your work remotely

title: Systems Engineer
description:
At Scandit, we develop real-time computer vision solutions for smartphones, wearables and robots that combine modern machine learning approaches with computer vision. To expand our engineering team, we are looking for a Systems Engineer.

We have varied infrastructure at Scandit. We run not just web applications but also handle non-trivial amounts of analytics events (tens of billions from hundreds of millions of devices), as well as process images from retail stores with computer vision algorithms. We also set up the infrastructure for CI and machine learning training both on-premise and in the cloud. It's never boring.

Our upcoming projects include processing tens of thousands of images taken by robots using machine learning algorithms. We need your help to scale the infrastructure for our projects and keep them running smoothly.

What You Will Do

This is what we are using. You don't need to know everything to apply.

Set up infrastructure using Terraform on AWS and Google Cloud (GCP)
Provision cloud infrastructure on Kubernetes (k8s) with Helm/Helmfile
Provision on-premise servers with Ansible and kubeadm
Help us migrate existing applications to Kubernetes
Keep our infrastructure services and dependencies up-to-date
Perform regular disaster recovery testing
Set up and monitor metrics using Prometheus and Grafana
Set up alerts for suspicious activity in logs
Be on an on-call rotation and respond to incidents
Write various helper tools in Python


How We Work


Your home will be the Web & Infrastructure team which we call a chapter
We work in cross-functional feature teams called squads
Our team speaks English and is located in Switzerland, Finland and Poland
We start every team meeting discussing new technologies, not problems
Scrum with 2-week sprints
Most of the team uses macOS but are proficient with Linux
GitLab Premium for code hosting and reviews as well as CI
Jira for ticket management
Confluence as a wiki for documentation
Slack for conversations
Google Workspace for email, calendar, documents
Zoom for video conferencing

***Please note as much as this is a remote position we will only be considering candidates based within two hours of Central European Time in order to preserve our teams collaborative culture***

Who We Are

Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.

Scandit’s mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit’s technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.

Many of the world’s most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit’s enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.

Scandit was founded by a group of researchers from ETH Zurich and MIT. The company is headquartered in Zurich and is also represented in Boston, London, Warsaw and Tampere. Over the years, our company has evolved into a world-class team of mobile image processing, computer vision, machine learning and “Internet of Things” experts from around the globe.
Industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

title: JavaScript Engineer
description:
Scandit is a high-growth tech startup from Switzerland with offices in Zurich, Boston, Warsaw, London, Tampere and Tokyo. Our technology enables barcode scanning on any standard mobile device and is used everyday by hundreds of global customers.

We are currently seeking an IT Service Desk Specialist to support the IT team in providing excellent IT services for our employees.

As an IT Service Desk Specialist, you are responsible for Scandit’s Service Desk and supporting our internal IT infrastructure, which includes employee laptops, productivity tools (mostly cloud-based, such as Google Workspace), networks and VPN, instant messaging, video conferencing as well as VoIP. In this role, you will have the opportunity to help shape the IT in a successful tech scaleup, play an important part in our monthly onboarding process of international new joiners and support distributed teams by providing reliable and state-of-the-art IT services.

If you want to make an important contribution to Scandit’s success and work in a fun and international environment of talented software engineers and young entrepreneurs, you are our person!

What You Will Do


Take care of our helpdesk by providing desktop, application and network support to both our local and remote users together with other members of the IT team
Enable new hires to achieve a perfect start with a structured IT onboarding and a high-touch onboarding experience
Manage user and group creations and deletions on various systems
Coordinate and process IT related orders (hardware and software) with external suppliers and manage the IT inventory
Ensure user education with high-quality documentation and how-tos
Maintain and troubleshoot on-premise infrastructure such as WiFi, wired network, printers and scanners
Keep track of IT-related issues and document their solutions for future reference
Implement internal IT projects


Who You Are


Proven experience with at least 2-4 years in a similar position
Strong analytical skills to evaluate complex problems and find a systematic approach to gain a quick but long lasting resolution
Broad knowledge of operating systems, particularly macOS, Windows and basic Linux knowledge
Knowledgeable in the administration of Google Workspace or a similar environment
Experience in using communication tools like Slack and Zoom
Basic knowledge of networking (DHCP, DNS, VPN, etc.)
Good sense of security (secure system setup, securing the network, educating employees on security best practices, etc.)
Ability to work independently and be able to face hectic situations calmly and with confidence
Ability to break down complex technical circumstances in a comprehensible manner for less technical minded people
Fluent in English (written and spoken), the language we normally use
You must be eligible to work in Switzerland


Who We Are

Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.

Scandit’s mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit’s technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery.

Many of the world’s most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit’s enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Nissan, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.
Industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

title: Experienced GNSS Engineer
description:
Fixposition




At Fixposition we motivate each other, share our ideas in open discussions, and are passionate about building the best product possible by implementing brave new approaches. Our diverse team is looking for a GNSS Engineer to help us on our mission to develop robust and highly accurate navigation solutions for robots and autonomous vehicles. Our innovative solution with cutting-edge computer vision and GNSS positioning technologies enables autonomous things of all shapes and sizes to operate in all kinds of challenging environments.

 

Fixposition is a Swiss startup located in Schlieren, Switzerland (9 mins from Zürich Main Station). More information can be found on our website: www.fixposition.com




About the role

Be part of the R&D team building our high-precision sensor for autonomous vehicles.
Take technical responsibility for the RTK (real-time kinematic) GNSS algorithms and implementation, support planning and design decisions in your area of expertise.
Collaborate with the entire team of software, sensor fusion, and vision engineers to maintain, improve, optimize, and extend the sensor performance and functionality on an embedded Linux system.
Contribute to the internal and customer documentation, testing, verification of the performance, analysis of defects, support tools.




About you

MSc or Ph.D. in geomatics engineering, robotics, mathematics, or equivalent experience.
Experience in GNSS algorithm development and implementation.
Excellent knowledge of real-time GNSS positioning (e.g., filters, adjustment theory, statistics) and RTK navigation algorithms (e.g., ambiguity resolution, differential positioning).
Hands-on knowledge of software design and development in the C or C++ programming language.
Expertly honed engineering and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in English (spoken and written).




Bonus points

Knowledge of computer vision or sensor fusion.
Knowledge of machine learning concepts.
Other programming languages, such as Python.
Knowledge of software testing, test automation, continuous integration.
Experience with development environments, revision control systems, build toolchains.
Experience with software development processes.




What we offer

Freedom to implement your ideas and have a meaningful impact on the development of an innovative product.
Exclusive technical insights into the autonomous robots and vehicles market with the ability to shape the way forward.
Personal growth in a multidisciplinary environment.
Regular team events to foster collaboration, openly discuss ideas, drive our innovative mindset, and just have some fun.




Apply

Be part of an innovative, challenging, and fun work environment in one of the most exciting startups in Switzerland. Join our mission!
